pyarcade.api module¶

show-inheritance

class pyarcade.api.Game(**kwargs)[source]¶

A SQLAlchemy Model used to store information about a Game and its state

class pyarcade.api.GameForm(formdata=<object object>, **kwargs)[source]¶

Represents a form to record the input from the user on pyarcade website

class pyarcade.api.GameListResource[source]¶

A Resource is a collection of routes (think URLs) that map to these functions. For a REST API, we have GET, PUT, POST, PATCH, DELETE, etc. Here we just define functions that map to the REST API verbs, later we map this to a specific URL with api.add_resource

get() → List[dict][source]¶

Responds to http://[domain or IP]:[port (default 5000)]/game

Returns

List of dictionaries describing all games in the database.

post() → dict[source]¶

Responds to http://[domain or IP]:[port (default 5000)]/games.

Adds a new game to the database.

Returns

Dictionary describing game that was just created.

class pyarcade.api.GameResource[source]¶

GameResource is slightly different from GameListResource as these functions will only respond to Responds to http://[domain or IP]:[port (default 5000)]/games/<game_id> so these are always executed in the context of a specific game.

delete(game_id)[source]¶

Responds to http://[domain or IP]:[port (default 5000)]/games/<game_id>

This is used to delete an existing game

Returns

Dictionary describing game that was changed.

get(game_id)[source]¶

Responds to http://[domain or IP]:[port (default 5000)]/games/<game_id>

Returns

Dictionary describing user by game_id

patch(game_id)[source]¶

Responds to http://[domain or IP]:[port (default 5000)]/games/<game_id>

This is used to update an existing game.

Returns

Dictionary describing game that was changed.

class pyarcade.api.LoginForm(formdata=<object object>, **kwargs)[source]¶

Represents a login form that is used to login a user

Parameters

  • username (str) – username field of user

  • Password (str) – password field of user

  • remember (bool) – boolean field checked to remember user

class pyarcade.api.RegisterForm(formdata=<object object>, **kwargs)[source]¶

Represents a form that allows a user to register for a pyaracade account

class pyarcade.api.SaveForm(formdata=<object object>, **kwargs)[source]¶

Represents a form to record the save name

class pyarcade.api.User(**kwargs)[source]¶

A SQLAlchemy Model used to store information about a user. This only needs to have a collection of class variables that are of type db.Column.

class pyarcade.api.UserListResource[source]¶

A Resource is a collection of routes (think URLs) that map to these functions. For a REST API, we have GET, PUT, POST, PATCH, DELETE, etc. Here we just define functions that map to the REST API verbs, later we map this to a specific URL with api.add_resource

get() → List[dict][source]¶

Responds to http://[domain or IP]:[port (default 5000)]/users

Returns

a list of dictionaries describing all users in the database. We should only include some information if passwords or other personal information is involved.

Return type

List

post() → dict[source]¶

Responds to http://[domain or IP]:[port (default 5000)]/users.

Adds a new user to the database.

Returns

Dictionary describing user that was just created.

class pyarcade.api.UserResource[source]¶

UserResource is slightly different from UserListResource as these functions will only respond to Responds to http://[domain or IP]:[port (default 5000)]/users/<user_id> so these are always executed in the context of a specific user.

delete(user_id)[source]¶

Responds to http://[domain or IP]:[port (default 5000)]/users/<user_id>

This is used to delete an existing user

Returns

Dictionary describing user that was changed.

get(user_id)[source]¶

Responds to http://[domain or IP]:[port (default 5000)]/users/<user_id>

Returns

Dictionary describing user by user_id

patch(user_id)[source]¶

Responds to http://[domain or IP]:[port (default 5000)]/users/<user_id>

This is used to update an existing user.

Returns

Dictionary describing user that was changed.

pyarcade.api.create_app()[source]¶

This is used as a factory function for creating the entire application instance when the application is first run. Best practices for FLASK is to allow creating an application instance ONLY using this function for very good reasons, but this is good enough to use for now.

pyarcade.gamedb module¶

show-inheritance

class pyarcade.gamedb.GameDB(**kwargs)[source]¶

game class that represents the model to create a game resource. Primarily represents a game and its save state

Parameters

  • id (int) – primary key that uniquely identifies a save

  • player_id (int) – key that uniquely identifies a user and is associated with this save

  • save_name (str) – name of the save

  • save (BLOB) – game object being saved

class pyarcade.input_system.InputSystem[source]¶

Class that handles input for all games

get_current_game()[source]¶

getter for current game

Returns

return current game which could be any of the games in pyarcade

Return type

game

handle_blackjack_input(user_input: str) → str[source]¶

Handles input varying from menu options such as reset, clear, save to game options such as hit or stand. This Accesses the blackjack game and runs blackjack logic based on user input and returns result for start.py to print out.

Parameters

user_input – input from user varying from menu options to game options such as hit or stand

Returns

returns current state of user and house hands

Return type

String

static handle_card(user_card: str)[source]¶

Finds a corresponding card based on user input and returns that card of type card. If none exist it returns None :param user_card: string representation of Users card played :type user_card: str

Returns

card with rank and suit specified None

Return type

Card

handle_crazy_eights_input(card_input: str) → str[source]¶
Handles input varying from game menu options such as help, save, clear and game options such as draw

Accesses the crazy eights game and runs crazy eights logic based on user input and returns result for

start.py to print out

Parameters

card_input (str) –

Returns

returns what the last card played was in the form of a string

Return type

String

handle_game_input(game_name: str, user_input: str)[source]¶

Handles input given game name (mastermind, minesweeper, crazy eights, blackjack, etc) and user input and returns the correct output based on which game and option is selected

Parameters

  • game_name (str) – name of the game to check input against

  • user_input (str) – user input representing which choice from main menu options is chosen

Returns:

handle_mastermind_input(guess_input)[source]¶

Accesses the mastermind game and runs mastermind logic based on user input and returns result for start.py to print out

Parameters

guess_input (str) – input that decides which menu option to take or guess to evaluate

Returns

A sequence of integers to be guessed by the player.

Return type

hidden_sequence List[int]

handle_minesweeper_input(location_input: str)[source]¶

Accesses the minesweeper game and runs minesweeper logic based on user input and returns result for start.py to print out

Parameters

location_input (str) – location of desired move represented as a string or menu option depending on format

Returns

a string representation of the minesweeper board

Return type

board_str (str)

save_game(game_object, save_name: str, user_id: int)[source]¶

Saves a game object through pickling

Parameters

  • game_object (BLOB) – game object to be pickled and saved in database

  • save_name (str) – name of the save for later reference

  • user_id (int) – unique identifier associated with user

Returns

None

save_game_by_username(game_object, save_name, username)[source]¶

saves a game and associates it with a given username, this takes the place of userid

Parameters

  • game_object (BLOB) – game object to be pickled and saved in database

  • save_name (str) – name of the save for later reference

  • username (str) – username to be associated with game save

Returns

None

pyarcade.start module¶

show-inheritance

pyarcade.start.run_pyarcade()[source]¶

Method used to start the pyarcade. Logic of navigating the pyarcade and starting selected games as well as output of choices are encapsulated in this method
